author: zsfelfoldi
content: Sure, we'll have to see how this thing behaves. Anyway, thanks a lot for helping me understand the details of it better ðŸ™‚

author: zsfelfoldi
content: again, we'll have to see. Somehow I imagined that this thing will be a lot noisier and even short series of 0/200% blocks will happen quite often. I'm not sure though, it was just an intuition that on the short term there might be self reinforcing deviations from the stable state. Even if I'm right it's not a tragedy though, the system will operate okay and we'll have time to understand the situation better.

author: sky.cactus
content: If the 200% are sufficiently short, then that probably won't impact things too much.

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree that we need to gather data though, and the best way to do that is to release and monitor.

author: timbeiko
content: I need to verify this, but I've also heard another big cause is the rise in use of Flashbots by miners. AIUI, it does a better job of only submitting "valid" MEV transactions on chain, and leads to less high-fee, failed transactions taking up blockspace and pushing up the price.

author: lightclient
content: also, i assume users are not minting gas tokens much anymore since the london hard fork will almost certainly break them
